alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:08PM EST until January 10 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Prince Edward, Cumberland and Amelia Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River above Farmville. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water approaches back of homes on Old Plank Rd, upstream of gage. Parking lot on Elm St. north of Main St. on southside of river begins to flood. At 18.0 feet, River Rd downstream of the gage near the railroad bridge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:50 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 17.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.1 feet on 12/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 600 AM EST.
